summary: Castro claimed that Biden's plan leaves 10 million people uncovered and that he wants every American family to have a strong Medicare plan available, while still allowing them to keep their private health insurance if they choose to do so.
Castro claimed to Vice President Biden that the difference between their healthcare plans is that Biden's plan requires people to opt in, while Castro's plan does not.
Castro claimed to Vice President Biden that his healthcare plan leaves 10 million people uncovered, and that Biden's plan requires people to opt in, while Castro's plan automatically enrolls them.

In the Democratic debate on September 12th, 2019, Pete Buttigieg criticized Bernie Sanders' healthcare bill, stating that it doesn't trust the American people. Buttigieg proposed Medicare for all who want it, allowing the American people to choose their healthcare. In response, Sanders questioned Buttigieg's concern for the 150 million people on private insurance.

During the Democratic debate on September 12th, 2019, Joe Biden claimed that there has been a significant shift in public opinion regarding gun control. He mentioned the organization Mothers Against Gun Violence and the recent youth-led marches in Washington as evidence of this change. Biden also stated that his proposals for gun control had gained support from over 50 percent of NRA members and a majority of the general public. He believes that more people now recognize the validity of his and others' arguments on this issue.

During the Democratic debate on September 12th, 2019, Jorge Ramos questioned Vice President Biden about his previous support for a border wall and the high number of deportations that occurred during the Obama administration. Biden responded by deflecting the question and stating that comparing President Trump to President Obama is outrageous.

During the Democratic debate on September 12th, 2019, Jorge Ramos questioned Vice President Biden about his previous support for a border wall and the high number of deportations during the Obama administration. Biden responded by stating that comparing President Trump to President Obama is outrageous and that they did not lock people up in cages.

Senator Booker claimed during the Democratic debate on September 12th, 2019 that the real question is not who is or isn't a racist, but who is going to do something about racism. He emphasized that simply calling out Donald Trump as a racist is not enough, and that the focus should be on addressing systemic racism in various aspects of society, such as healthcare and the criminal justice system.

Warren claimed during the Democratic debate on September 12th, 2019 that the reason gun control measures are not being implemented is due to corruption and the influence of the gun industry on Congress. She argued that unless this issue is addressed directly and the filibuster is rolled back, no progress will be made on gun control.
